caption.p: A minimum two-step sequential reassortment was proposed for the evolution of H7N9, with the latest reassortment occurring in early 2012. The first reassortment likely took place between two distinct species of wild birds, incorporating a distinct H9N2 virus. The resulting virus transmitted to Chinese domestic birds before undergoing a second reassortment, with more recent H9N2 viruses already circulating in Chinese poultry. Reprinted/adapted from [ 25], Copyright 2013, with permission from Elsevier.
